text: Improvement pill here most of us know
how it feels to be nervous about
something Hearts hammering inside your
chest shaky hands shortness of breath or
even excessive sweating and what's one
well-known cause of these types of
nerves public speaking in fact fear of
public speaking or glossophobia is one
of the most common phobia according to
the National social anxiety Center and
affects around 40% of the population a
little while back we noticed one
commenter asking for help in dealing
with this exact phobia they said
whenever I'm at school and a teacher
wants me to read say or answer something
I'm always under a lot of stress and
only get the first words out after
stuttering a few times what can I do
about this fear of public speaking is a
type of social anxiety the main cause of
most social anxieties is an underlying
fear of judgment or negative evaluation
from others so the natural answer to
this is to stop putting so much
importance on other people's opinions
and judgments but that's much easier
said than done that's why we're going to
Deep dive into the concept of detachment
and how you can use this one relatively
simple idea to let go and stop anxiety
and nerves from controlling you but
first to understand how to detach we
need to figure out why we feel nervous
or fear in the first place the answer
over attachment many of us are over
attached to ourselves the way we look
sound and come across to others when the
reality is that no one cares as much
about you as you do and placing this
importance on yourself and how others
see you we add tremendous pressure on
ourselves we overanalyze who we are how
we behave and what people might think of
US enter social anxiety in small amounts
pressure can be helpful but add too much
and it could be crippling this is where
Detachment comes in Detachment isn't
about not caring about things in life
it's about being selective over what you
do care about it's about asking yourself
if it's good for you to be mentally over
involved in something or if it just
gives you unnecessary Stress and Anxiety
nine times out of 10 you actually do
better when you're more relaxed it's why
young or new athletes often perform
better when they're training compared to
when they compete the pressure of the
crowd and the desire to win causes them
to tense up just like this commenter who
gets stressed and stutters in class so
how can we detach we can reduce this
self-inflicted pressure and detach from
a situation in a few ways the first is
by using the let them Theory the let
them theory is about creating distance
between you and other people's thoughts
feelings decisions and actions it's
about detaching from other people and
focusing on yourself and what's best for
you say if your friends go to a party
one weekend and no one invites you you
let them overthinking the situation and
getting upset over it will only cause
you suffering or if you're nervous to
speak in front of a crowd of people
because you fear what they might think
of you if you let them think whatever
they like you take away the power and
control other people have over you you
start reclaiming the power and decide to
feel think and do the things that are in
your best interest and what's the result
you're more relaxed and confident and
you live for yourself you get your time
back instead of worrying about what
people might think of you you end up
living a much more happy and content
Life as a result so next time your heart
is beating or your palms are sweaty try
to pinpoint the fear behind this
reaction and by letting them you might
find you're able to relax a bit more the
next theory is about the law of reversed
effort the law of reversed effort is
about the level of Desire we have over
doing something the more we want
something the more difficult it becomes
to achieve so in relation to social
anxiety and public public speaking the
more we want people to like us and the
more we try to control how the situation
goes the more difficult it gets to
achieve what we want the more we freeze
stutter our hands begin to shake this is
where Detachment comes in if we care
less and we stop trying to control the
situation we can begin to relax about it
one great way of doing this in the
moment is through grounding techniques
focusing on your breathing your
environment or how your body feels is a
great way to quiet an anxious mind and
give yourself mental distance from the
situation a popular grounding technique
is to name five things in your
environment that you can see this can be
anything from people to objects or even
colors you can then move on to naming
five things you can hear maybe the growl
of car engines birds chirping or the
chatter of people nearby it doesn't
matter what you can hear what matters is
that you bring yourself out of the
pressure that your mind is creating
about the situation and into the present
moment knowing about the law of reversed
efforts is a powerful tool we've even
got a video video that goes into more
detail on this if you're looking for
something else to watch after this one
the next theory that uses Detachment is
coined by another bestselling author
Mark Manson Manson's book The subtle art
of not giving an F uses the concept of
giving distance to your problems and
taking responsibility for them to take
back control over your life by giving
distance to our problems we give them
less power try asking this question how
will you feel about this in 5 years
chances are you're not going to remember
the moment you read aloud in class one
day at school the next step is to take
responsibility for the problem or
scenario only you have the power to
overcome the problem do you want to stay
nervous and scared or do you want
instead to become a confident and
happier version of yourself the choice
is yours and it's your responsibility to
work on this to overcome it you can do
anything you put your mind to so why not
this the last and potentially one of the
most helpful theories is impression
management what if you don't feel
confident well you can fake it
impression management uses the concept
of acting like a version of yourself
that would be successful in a situation
giving you the confidence you need to do
it if you need to come across as a
natural public speaker for a
presentation at school or work you can
act like you are even if you don't feel
like it acting like you do in the moment
tricks your mind into thinking you can
it gives you an opportunity to practice
and acts as a way to prove to yourself
you can do it one way we like to use
impression management is by taking our
favorite character from a film who may
be good in high pressure situations
funny friendly relaxed or confident and
channeling them for example take the
cool calm confidence of Robert Downey Jr
as Tony Stark a genius engineer Tony
Stark takes responsibility in any
situation he remains relaxed in the face
of any Challenge and channeling this
type of energy can be a great low
pressure way to detach from any fears or
blockers you might have there we have it
Detachment is an incredibly useful
concept gives you back your power and
control over your life using techniques
such as the let them Theory the law of
reversed effort distancing and taking
responsibility for your problems and
impression management can help you to
get over your anxiety and nerves with
practice and exposure to these stressful
situations you can get over your fears
and stop letting them rule over your
life take back the control have you
gotten over a fear or anxiety in the
past share your experience in the
comments below thanks for watching and
as ever stay
